sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Time.Elapsed function returns the amount of time since a program (process) started running. The number of milliseconds since the program started running is returned.
sections.text_content: The Time.Elapsed function returns the amount of time since a program (process) started running. The number of milliseconds since the program started running is returned.
sections.mdown_content: The **Time.Elapsed** function returns the amount of time since a program (process) started running. The number of milliseconds since the program started running is returned.

sections.title: Example
code:
var timeRunning : int
        timeRunning := Time.Elapsed
        put "This program has run ", timeRunning, " milliseconds"
sections.raw_content: This program tells you how much time it has used.
sections.text_content: This program tells you how much time it has used.
sections.mdown_content: This program tells you how much time it has used.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
On IBM PC compatibles, this is the total time since the Turing system was started up. The hardware resolution of duration is in units of 55 milliseconds. For example, Time.Elapsed may be off by as much as 55 milliseconds.

On Apple Macintoshes, this is the total time since the machine was turned on. The hardware resolution of duration is in units of 17 milliseconds (1/60-th of a second).

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Time.Elapsed, not by calling Elapsed.
sections.text_content:
